Name: Stela
Description: This object in limestone, which was acquired in Thebes in 1905 by J. Capart, constitutes a sort of stela. The upper part carries a hieroglyphic inscription with an offering formula written on five lines. The bottom of the stela is decorated with a scene depicting 4 seated people, arranged two by two, around an offering table and sniffing a flower. The piece is in the name of Sobekaa, a scribe who lived in Thebes in the Middle Kingdom.
